item.title: 全球债务基金持续买入，韩国市场渡过危机
item.description: 韩国在与政治危机作斗争的同时，也避免了一场金融漩涡，这凸显了韩国市场在迅速努力安抚投资者的支持下已经成熟到了何种程度。【原文：South Korea was spared a financial maelstrom even as it battles a political crisis, underscoring the extent to which its markets have matured, bolstered by swift efforts to reassure investors.】

item.title: 拜登阻止美国钢铁收购后，新日铁下跌
item.description: 自美国总统乔-拜登阻止日本新日铁公司计划以 141 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司以来的首个交易日，新日铁公司股价周一下滑。【原文：Shares in Nippon Steel Corp. slipped on Monday, the first day of trading since US President Joe Biden blocked the Japanese company’s planned $14.1 billion takeover of United States Steel Corp.】

item.title: 特朗普困扰央行 2025 年谨慎降息
item.description: 全球央行行长们准备在 2025 年进一步削减借贷成本，但他们只是谨慎行事，并密切关注即将上任的美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政策。【原文：Global central bankers are poised to cut borrowing costs further in 2025, but only warily — and with a keen eye on the policies of incoming US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 在 2008 年赚取数十亿美元的交易员重返市场，押注市场波动
item.description: 一位前对冲基金经理的公司在全球金融危机期间赚取了数十亿美元，他认为市场稳定面临的威胁达到了自2008年以来从未有过的程度，因此准备再次扑向波动。【原文：A former hedge fund manager whose firm made billions during the global financial crisis is ready to pounce on volatility again, as he sees threats to market stability at a level not seen since 2008.】

item.title: 以下是 2025 年亚洲最值得关注的上市公司
item.description: 由于印度的首次公开募股管道依然强劲，香港的复苏势头也在持续，交易商们预计 2025 年亚洲的首次公开募股将出现复苏。【原文：Dealmakers are eyeing a revival in Asia’s initial public offerings in 2025 as India’s pipeline remains robust and a recovery in Hong Kong takes hold.】

item.title: 中国政府解决产能过剩问题，中国炼油厂面临倒计时
item.description: 中国独立炼油厂今年将面临一场清算，因为中国政府要解决该行业产能过剩的问题，而它们所依赖的原油也将变得更加稀缺。【原文：China’s independent oil refineries face a reckoning this year as Beijing tackles overcapacity in the industry, and the crude they rely on becomes a lot scarcer.】

item.title: 石油维持在两个月高位附近，股市将高开
item.description: 在经历了两周的上涨之后，石油价格在更广泛的市场风险情绪的推动下保持稳定。【原文：Oil was steady after two weeks of gains, buoyed by a risk-on tone in wider markets.】

item.title: 据说 Paychex 正在洽谈收购规模较小的竞争对手 Paycor
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Paychex 公司正在就收购薪酬处理领域规模较小的竞争对手 Paycor HCM 公司进行深入谈判。【原文：Paychex Inc. is in advanced talks to acquire Paycor HCM Inc., a smaller rival in payroll processing, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街反弹后亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在华尔街结束了五天连跌之后，亚洲股市在大型科技股的新一轮需求帮助下，周一在主要市场出现上涨。【原文：Asian equities were primed to rise in major markets on Monday after Wall Street snapped a five-day losing streak, helped along by fresh demand for big tech stocks.】

item.title: 调查显示：英国企业信心降至特鲁斯迷你预算案以来最低点
item.description: 英国商会（British Chambers of Commerce）的一项调查显示，英国企业信心已降至两年多前保守党前首相利兹-特拉斯（Liz Truss）发布灾难性小型预算案以来的最低水平，这与人们对现任工党政府增税的担忧不谋而合。【原文：UK business confidence has dropped to its lowest level since former Conservative Prime Minister Liz Truss’s disastrous mini-budget more than two years ago, according to a survey by the British Chambers of Commerce that echoes concerns over the current Labour government’s tax hikes.】

item.title: 拜登在罕见的公开签字仪式上签署社会保障法案
item.description: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统签署了一项法案，该法案将增加数百万美国人的社会保障福利，这是他两年多来首次举行公开法案签署仪式。【原文：President Joe Biden signed into law a bill that will increase Social Security benefits for millions of Americans — his first public bill signing ceremony in more than two years.】

item.title: 人民币交易员期待中国人民银行定盘价衡量外汇支持水平
item.description: 人民币走软，跌破了中国在整个 12 月一直捍卫的水平，这让人们重新关注中国管理货币的每日参考汇率，以衡量中国政府支持人民币的意愿。【原文：The yuan weakening past a level that China had been defending throughout December has returned the spotlight to its daily reference rate for the managed currency to gauge Beijing’s appetite to support it.】

item.title: Sam Altman 谈 ChatGPT 的头两年、埃隆-马斯克和特朗普治下的人工智能
item.description:
采访 OpenAI 联合创始人。【原文：

An interview with the OpenAI co-founder.

】

item.title: IPhone 供应商 TDK 推出新型电池，与人工智能保持同步
item.description: TDK 公司是苹果公司 iPhone 手机电池的主要供应商之一，今年将推出其最先进产品的改进版，以帮助移动设备跟上内置人工智能不断增长的电力需求。【原文：TDK Corp., one of the main suppliers of batteries for Apple Inc.’s iPhones, will this year roll out an improved version of its most advanced product to help mobile devices keep up with the rising power demands of built-in AI.】

item.title: CC Capital 出价收购澳大利亚 Insignia Financial 公司
item.description: 澳大利亚财富管理公司 Insignia Financial Ltd. 周一发表声明称，已收到 CC Capital Partners 的收购要约。【原文：Australian wealth manager Insignia Financial Ltd. has received a takeover offer from CC Capital Partners, according to a statement Monday.】

item.title: 首席财务官为 2025 年的特朗普、关税和更多人工智能做好准备
item.description:
另外，America Movil的财务主管谈到了墨西哥比索和开拓当地债务市场的问题。【原文：

Plus, America Movil’s finance chief talks about the Mexican peso and tapping local debt markets.

】

item.title: 特朗普准备对华加征关税，澳元熊市看跌至 60 美分
item.description: 澳元在 2024 年创下六年来最大跌幅，但其跌势似乎远未结束；未来几个月，澳元很有可能跌破 60 美分。【原文：The Australian dollar slid the most in six years in 2024 but its decline looks far from over — there’s every prospect it will fall below 60 US cents in coming months.】

item.title: 特朗普给前景蒙上阴影，债券交易员认为未来一年充满变数
item.description: 进入新的一年，债券交易员们的期望值降低了，因为美国经济的韧性以及当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的减税和关税政策有可能使国债继续承压。【原文：Bond traders are entering the new year with diminished expectations as the resilient US economy and President-elect Donald Trump’s tax-cut and tariff policies threaten to keep Treasuries under pressure.】

item.title: 莫桑比克反对党领袖计划于 1 月 9 日回国
item.description: 他说，这位莫桑比克反对派领导人自东南非国家10月大选以来一直在指挥为期数周的抗议活动，他计划于1月9日结束自我流放返回莫桑比克。【原文：The Mozambican opposition leader, who’s been directing weeks of protests since the southeast African nation’s October elections, plans to return from self-exile on Jan. 9, he said.】

item.title: 美国例外论将在 2025 年推动股市和美元：MLIV 脉搏
item.description: 彭博市场实时脉搏（Bloomberg Markets Live Pulse）最新调查显示，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政策将推动美国经济增长，美国股市和美元将成为最大受益者。【原文：US stocks and the dollar will be the biggest beneficiaries of American economic growth set to be boosted by Donald Trump’s policies, according to the latest Bloomberg Markets Live Pulse survey.】

item.title: 约翰逊称特朗普的主要立法议程将在五月前通过
item.description: 美国国会众议院议长迈克-约翰逊（Mike Johnson）誓言，将在四月份投票通过一项雄心勃勃的法案，该法案将涉及当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的一系列优先事项，这对于众议院中分歧严重的议员来说是一个紧迫的日程表。【原文：Speaker Mike Johnson vowed that an ambitious bill addressing a range of President-elect Donald Trump’s priorities will be voted out of the US House in April, a tight schedule for his narrowly divided chamber.】

item.title: 据说奥米德-马利克的 SPAC 接近与枪支零售商 GrabAGun 达成交易
item.description: Omeed Malik 的特殊目的收购公司 Colombier Acquisition Corp.II 接近达成与在线枪支零售商 GrabAGun 合并的协议，许多其他华尔街投资者可能会因为 ESG 原则而回避这一交易。【原文：Omeed Malik’s special purpose acquisition company Colombier Acquisition Corp. II is close to an agreement to merge with online firearms retailer GrabAGun, a deal likely eschewed by many other Wall Street investors over ESG principles.】

item.title: 股市的 "一月效应 "是真的吗？
item.description: 几十年来，一种流行的理论认为，美国股市在一月份的涨幅往往高于其他月份。这种现象被称为 "一月效应"，它的存在曾一度似乎是不可否认的，因为研究表明，一月份的涨幅是平均月份的数倍。从 1940 年到 20 世纪 70 年代中期，这种效应在小型公司股票中最为明显。但到 2000 年左右，这种效应似乎有所减弱，此后就不再那么可靠了。【原文：For decades, a popular theory has held that US stocks tend to rise more in January than in other months. The existence of this phenomenon, known as the January effect, once appeared to be undeniable as studies showed gains several times larger in January than in an average month. The effect was most pronounced among small-company stocks from 1940 to the mid-1970s. But it seemed to shrink through around 2000 and hasn’t been as reliable since.】

item.title: 第一生命出售长期债券亏损 1,400 亿日元
item.description: 第一生命保险公司（Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co.【原文：Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co. lost about ¥140 billion ($890 million) selling off bonds with longer maturities to prepare for higher interest rates.】

item.title: 金融科技公司加大广告投入以吸引更广泛的市场
item.description: 无论你是在乘坐地铁、走到机场登机口，还是在等公交车，有一种广告越来越难以错过，那就是基于技术的金融服务广告，从信用卡到在线支付平台，再到数字银行。【原文：Whether you’re riding the subway, walking to an airport gate, or waiting for the bus, there’s a certain kind of advertisement that has become increasingly difficult to miss: pitches for technology-based financial services, from credit cards to online payment platforms to digital banking.】

item.title: 特朗普和美联储被认为有可能在拉美大肆发行 1,270 亿美元债券
item.description: 拉美借款人以三年来最快的速度涌入全球市场的债务销售热潮，将在 2025 年逐渐平息。【原文：A debt-sale bonanza that saw Latin American borrowers rush to global markets at the fastest pace in three years is set to peter out in 2025.】

item.title: 美联航将于今年晚些时候在美国提供马斯克的 Starlink Wi-Fi 服务
item.description: 美国联合航空公司控股公司（United Airlines Holdings Inc.【原文：United Airlines Holdings Inc. expects to begin using SpaceX’s Starlink for inflight Wi-Fi in the spring, an earlier-than-expected rollout for the first major US carrier to use Elon Musk’s satellite business.】

item.title: 捷克中央银行行长称预算赤字是最大的通胀风险
item.description: 捷克央行行长阿莱什-米歇尔（Ales Michl）呼吁政府平衡预算，以帮助防止未来再次出现通货膨胀。【原文：Czech central bank chief Ales Michl called on the government to balance its budget to help prevent any future inflation resurgence.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长武伊契奇：克罗地亚旅游业可能会受到物价上涨的影响
item.description: 克罗地亚央行行长鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）警告说，过去几年物价上涨的累积影响可能会损害该国至关重要的旅游业。【原文：Croatian central bank Governor Boris Vujcic warned that the country’s vital tourism sector could be harmed by the cumulative impact of price hikes over the last few years.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，在创纪录的一年之后，Centerview 可能会考虑其他选择
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Centerview Partners 联合创始人布莱尔-埃夫隆（Blair Effron）表示，在抵制竞争对手采取的措施后，该公司可能会对潜在的股份出售或接受外部投资者持开放态度。【原文：Centerview Partners co-founder Blair Effron says the firm may be open to a potential share sale or accepting external investors after resisting steps taken by rivals, the Wall Street Journal reported.】
